q.q:
what if you didnt filter out stuff for reality and instead released all? then your content with regards to your self documenting can be as efficient as possible. 1 hour of work (minus logistic time expenses) = 1 hour content. I just recorded my first hour of thoughts (not trying to organize my thoughts but to think outloud entertainingly, entertaining myself pretty much and my thoughts, kinda the free form posts i can sometimes make here), and i keep thinking but can't really think of anyone who would be interested in listening to outloud thinking when its not for entertaining purposes. But I think maybe there might. Like, I turned on the mic and thought out loud it for 52 minutes and thinking of it being able to be as a standalone thing that's releasable. And I keep thinking but i think its maybe just a bit less tiring to do it without that extra minigame. Do you think that minigame should be the norm? that i should strive to be as entert aining/e fficient thoughtwise even when the mics off. Now if that were the case, wouldn't that make my aspiration to have every thought be content? Then how would I organize that, and when? I think maybe theres a benefit of only turning it on in certain times and be able to verbalize what has been inner dialogue only for a while, and that in itself can be an interesting display of words over time.
I'd like to invite you to be the first listener of the first outloud thought session. (the whole what the hell is a podcast thing rubbed off on me which is why ive avoided the word throughout this, i realize i have a similar thing with "philosophizing", its just thinking really, the proper way perhaps, although thats already adding a bit of my biases).

I think not thinking of it as a podcast would limit myself to thinking "you cant release 3 today!" If i felt like recording 3 outloud thought sessions in a day. because that doesn't fit my idea of what a podcast is, and that ma y bias the way i do what i do and how i do it or even worse, how i think of it.

Turns out i came here to ask about why not release unedited reality footage but i really just wanted to talk about my first time doing something that felt natural since I am still riding that high.

Hope you're having a bunch of fun and fulfilment playing around with your process and thanks for doing what you do and how you do it, i wouldnt be able to think doing whatever made sense if i didnt see you make sense of whatever you do.

I'd normally go back and add parenthesis to afterthoughts but ive learned its more pure when the words are chronologically put where they are.

q.a: step 1, use Karabiner, but instead of swapping keys, disable all the keys (set every key to vk disable). that will be like 100 items to add and 2 pop-up menus each, so i recommend using kbm for assistance to get through it. disable the keys on every extra keyboard (not your main keyboard) then, in keyboard maestro, when you add a trigger, instead of using "HotKey" trigger (that would be for your regular keyboard) use "USB device key". it should come right up. as long as the keyboards aren't the exact same model, they will be recognized as different. Actually, i'm pretty sure that they will all be recognized as different no matter what. i've never actually tried to use 2 that are the identically exact same model so i'm not sure, but i'm pretty sure it would be fine. then, one slight problem you may run into, next time you restart your computer, if the keyboards don't work when you restart, just sleep the computer real quick and wake it up. then they should work. another side warning, if you do get this working, watch out for the binge-buying of keyboards that may occur as a result

q.a: i wrote song, recorded it, finished it to the final mix. done. then started a video for it, but for some reason, there was a little voice in my head that told me to instead of using the 3D program for just little bits of the video, how about using it for the entire thing. well, for those of you who don't know, 3D video usually takes 100,000 years longer than anyone would ever imagine. but another interesting thing about 3D, is that it seems like the whole universe has just opened up. in ways that i have only dreamed about. vast new world. resonating strongly with filmmaking desires i've probably had since childhood but never admitted it, because 3D graphics has never really been anything that 1 person alone could really delve into, perhaps until this generation. so i'd say it was about 2 solid months down the rabbit hole of working on that music video, which really was turning out to the most exciting thing i had ever worked on. then it began to occur to me that now is a better time than ever to upgrade to a much newer system, because the reason i had waited was because my previous full time video software was long ago discontinued, and literally only worked on old computers. so i've been stuck on an old computer system for many years. given that i found myself now working on different software (the 3D one) which is not discontinued, it began to occur to me that the big shift is imminent. then a series of events unfolded that suddenly plunged me into the shift. and in the process, a thousand more doors and windows have begun to open. the possibilities are wildly beyond my greatest imagination. an interesting twist is, my entire old method no longer works on this new system (at least for video. for music everything's pretty much still intact, with all the benefit of the new system.) the old video system is still available on an ancient computer in the corner, but let's face it, the new possibilities wipe the old system off the map

q.a: i've found it's the only way to play that fake trumpet that sounds any good. i used to not use that instrument at all, because i didn't think i could get anything good out of it. but in early 2015 i was doing some in depth experiments with instrument randomization (pick random instrument, THEN, you figure out (non-randomly) where in the song it fits. anywhere. beginning, end, bar 10.5 of verse 2, find a place to fit it in.) the trumpet came up, as a classic 'you're fucked' moment, but because of the nature of the experiment i was challeneged to find a spot for it, and there was one place sort of near the climax of the song, that, sure enough, it worked, played as short chord stabs. change my whole world up, and i've been using it in a similar manner ever since. usually having a tendency to find the exact only spot it would work

q.a: put every item into a list / inventory, so you know what you have. then, by some method, (chronologically, randomized, .... your choice), go through each one and open up a conversation about it, talk about it. think about the origins of it. and then just diagnose whatever seems to be getting in the way of it expressing that true original purpose. then start from the beginning, and keep starting again from the beginning and stop whenever it's not good enough. and keep working on it until the whole thing is good all the way through. sometimes you need time to pass before getting a new clean run through, but sometimes i can trick my mind into a reset by touching the door of the room i'm in, and returning

q.a: it's RGB. the first 2 digits are red, the middle 2 is green, the last 2 is blue. it's hexidecimal, but let's pretend for a moment it's regular. higher number is brighter. so 00 00 00 would be no red, no green, no blue. so that means totally black. 99 00 00 means a lot of red, no green, no blue. so that's red. 99 00 55 means red with a little bit of blue. so maybe magenta. But all this is slightly false because the numbers are actually supposed to be hexidecimal. which means instead of 0123456789, it's 0123456789abcdef. so 00 is the least and ff is the most. so 00FF00 is full green, 0000FF is full blue, 0000EE is almost full blue, and FFFFFF is full white. 888888 is grey. 995555 would be grey with a slightly reddish tint. 'A' comes after 9, so AA5555 would be the same but slightly more red. etc
